events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: Uganda's debt crisis deepens ahead of elections
events.summary: With debt at record highs and new loans approved, Uganda faces growing pressure. Economists warn the strategy may backfire on future growth.

events.title: Mercosur deal: French farmers roll tractors into Paris
events.summary: Scores of tractors were driven into Paris in protest over an EU deal that would create the world's largest free-trade area. Some farmers fear they will be undercut with cheaper goods from South America.

events.title: As China sales slow, can India drive German car growth?
events.summary: For decades, German cars symbolized engineering perfection and economic power. Now sales are down as their key market, China, goes electric. India could fill some of that gap left by China, but it would be a tall ask.

events.title: Berlin mayor criticized for playing tennis during blackout
events.summary: Mayor Kai Wegner is facing pressure over taking a tennis break during the first hours of what turned out to be the longest blackout in the German capital's postwar history.

events.title: Iran: A timeline of mass protests since 1999
events.summary: By using violence and repression, Iran's theocratic regime has managed to cling to power and overcome several anti-government movements in recent decades.

events.title: Cambodia extradites suspected crypto scam boss to China
events.summary: Chen Zhi is accused of running scam centers that used forced labor to target victims worldwide. Cambodia handed him over to China after months of international pressure.

events.title: Ukraine: 1 million without water, heat after Russian strike
events.summary: Ukraine says overnight Russian strikes targeted energy infrastructure in Dnipropetrovsk and Zaporizhzhia, amid freezing temperatures. Meanwhile, Russia says foreign troops sent to Ukraine would be targets. DW has more.

events.title: Saudi Arabia says UAE smuggled out Yemen separatist leader
events.summary: Aidarous al-Zubaidi was accused of treason shortly before fleeing to Abu Dhabi, amid an escalating Saudi-UAE row as they back competing factions in Yemen.

events.title: Maduro's downfall deals China new cards in US rivalry
events.summary: Beijing is "deeply shocked" by the Trump administration's attack on Venezuela, one of China's key partners in Latin America. At the same time, China could find ways to use the kidnapping of Maduro for its own agenda.

events.title: Germany news: Snow warnings for Hamburg, 'Elli' storm nears
events.summary: German forecasters are warning of disruptive snow and ice in the north, and across most of the country overnight. Meanwhile, Berlin Mayor Kai Wegner is facing criticism for playing tennis amid power outage. DW has more.

events.title: China squeezes Japan on dual-use exports amid Taiwan spat
events.summary: Japan called new Chinese restrictions on dual-use exports for its military "absolutely unacceptable," while Beijing followed up with additional limits on dichlorosilane, a chemical used to make semiconductors.

events.title: Germany's local governments face financial collapse
events.summary: Many cities and municipalities in Germany are near bankruptcy, and no longer know how they're supposed to fulfill their responsibilities. They are blaming the federal government.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US interventions in Latin America
events.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the US in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Former NATO envoy says Trump still committed to Ukraine
events.summary: Kurt Volker said Trump wants a quick end to the war, but the conflict continues because Russia's Putin believes he can still prevail.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.summary: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: Venezuela: Trump's $3 billion oil windfall — why it matters
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has announced an agreement with Venezuela's interim government to transfer millions of barrels of oil to the US. DW explores how the plan could be a blow to China, Russia, Iran and Cuba.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Zelenskyy in Cyprus as EU presidency begins
events.summary: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is in Nicosia, while Ukrainian and US negotiators remain in Paris, looking to iron out more details of Tuesday's "robust" security guarantees agreement. Meanwhile, the fighting continues. DW has more.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: Germany news: Power back in Berlin after arson attack
events.summary: Berlin officials say power has been restored in the southwest of the city after an act of "sabotage" caused a major blackout. Federal prosecutors are investigating a left-wing extremist group. DW has more.

events.title: Trump weighs military option to take control of Greenland
events.summary: The US president has argued that control of Greenland is a "strategic" necessity. Secretary of State Marco Rubio has tried to downplay Trump's rhetoric, emphasizing the preferred option would be to buy Greenland.

events.title: Greenland welcomes European solidarity amid Trump's threats
events.summary: Greenland's prime minister has thanked European allies for their backing after renewed claims on the island by US President Donald Trump. Jens-Frederik Nielsen urged Washington to engage in "respectful dialogue."

events.title: Cold snap hits Europe, disrupting travel
events.summary: Freezing temperatures and snow are gripping much of the continent, disrupting flights and causing traffic accidents. Canals froze in London, cross country skiers took to Hamburg cycle paths, and snow even fell in Madrid.

events.title: Germany news: Merz issues business SOS in letter to allies
events.summary: Chancellor Merz has told coalition politicians the situation in several key German businesses is "very critical." He said the government must prioritize improving areas like energy and labor costs in 2026. Follow DW.

events.title: Unpacking Czechia's devotion to cash and its currency
events.summary: The new government in Prague wants to change the constitution to anchor the Czech crown as the country's legal tender and guarantee the right to use cash, not just cards. Why has it made this pledge, and will it happen?

events.title: NATO could end if US takes over Greenland — Danish PM
events.summary: Denmark's Mette Frederiksen said "everything would stop" in the event of a US attack on another NATO country. European leaders have backed Frederiksen while saying the US "is an essential partner."

events.title: Swiss NYE fire: Bar had not been inspected for 5 years
events.summary: A fire at the Le Constellation bar in the ski resort town of Crans-Montana killed 40 and injured 116 people on New Year's Eve. Swiss authorities have launched a criminal probe into the bar managers.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.summary: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Berlin blackout: How dangerous are left‑wing extremists?
events.summary: A left‑wing extremist group has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Berlin power plant. What drives such an attack, and how serious a threat does this radical network pose?

events.title: After Venezuela, can the EU protect Greenland from the US?
events.summary: Donald Trump's claims on Greenland are worrying Europe once again. After the US attack on Venezuela, concerns are growing over how far Washington might go — and if the EU has any real tools to defend Danish territory.

events.title: Venezuela: Germany hesitates to condemn US attack
events.summary: The German government seems to have three things on its mind in regard to US capture of of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro: be cautious, wait and see and don't upset Donald Trump.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.summary: The German economy desperately needs a boost in 2026 after years of downturn. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: What to make of Israel's military plans with Greece, Cyprus
events.summary: Cyprus, Greece and Israel are set to step up joint military exercises and training. Turkey seems more concerned about the two EU members' growing procurement of advanced weapons systems from Israel.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin still shivering amid power outage
events.summary: Authorities say left-wing extremists likely carried out an arson attack that has left many Berliners without power. And alcohol can be purchased more cheaply in Germany than almost anywhere else in the EU. DW has more

events.title: Can developing countries leapfrog fossil fuels?
events.summary: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course.

events.title: Ghanaian artist Ibrahim Mahama at top of the art world
events.summary: Best known for large-scale burlap sack installations, Ibrahim Mahama is helping shift power in the art world to the Global South while redefining art as a collective practice.

events.title: Denmark urges Trump to cease threats to take over Greenland
events.summary: The Danish prime minister has said the US doesn't have the right to annex the territory, after Donald Trump again said the US needs Greenland for national security reasons.

events.title: Asylum applications in Germany down by half in 2025
events.summary: The Interior Ministry has attributed the drop in applications to stricter migration policies, but other factors also played a role.

events.title: What's next for Venezuela oil after US ousts Maduro?
events.summary: US President Donald Trump says now that Nicolas Maduro is gone, more US oil companies will enter Venezuela and spend billions revitalizing its oil industry. Several key questions have to be answered.

events.title: Greek aviation disrupted by radio communication issues
events.summary: Airports in Greece suspended arrivals and departures amid radio frequency disturbances. Some flights resumed later in the day.

events.title: Germany: Power back for some Berliners, but others freeze on
events.summary: Thousands of households in Berlin might have to wait several days for power, amid freezing temperatures after an outage caused by possible arson. Mayor Kai Wegner called the attack "terrorism."

events.title: Accordion renews image as Germany's top instrument for 2026
events.summary: The accordion is gaining worldwide popularity. Germany has declared it the instrument of the year for 2026. This versatile music maker is used across various genres, from tango to heavy metal.

events.title: Who is Zelenskyy's new chief of staff, Kyrylo Budanov?
events.summary: Lieutenant General Kyrylo Budanov is the first military officer to head Volodymyr Zelenskyy's presidential office. The head of the military secret service HUR is one of the country's most popular civil servants.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.summary: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste? And why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: Swiss fire safety under scrutiny after Crans-Montana blaze
events.summary: After the deadly fire at the Constellation bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana, questions are growing about the country's safety regulations.

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.summary: Elon Musk's Tesla has had a tough year and faced intensifying competition from Chinese and European rivals.

events.title: Finnish police arrest 2 over undersea cable damage
events.summary: They were part of the crew aboard a cargo vessel suspected of severing a telecom cable linking Finland and Estonia.

events.title: Germany news: Household wealth reaches record €10 trillion
events.summary: German households are holding record levels of financial assets amid economic uncertainty. Meanwhile, the number of illegal border entries in Germany has decreased by over 50% in the past two years. DW has more.

events.title: Amsterdam church destroyed by New Year's blaze
events.summary: The beloved 154-year-old Vondel Church in Amsterdam was devastated by a massive fire that erupted shortly after midnight on New Year's Day.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Zelenskyy says Russia fired 200 drones overnight
events.summary: Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia's strikes show the urgent need for air defense in Ukraine. Meanwhile, the Kremlin blamed Kyiv for a deadly drone strike on a hotel in the occupied Kherson region.

events.title: Bulgaria joins eurozone despite opposition
events.summary: Bulgaria became the 21st member of the currency union, bringing the number of people using the single European currency to more than 350 million.

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria crash
events.summary: The British heavyweight sustained injuries in a car crash that killed two of his friends.

events.title: What to know about 2026 European Capitals of Culture
events.summary: This year, Oulu, Finland, and Trencin, Slovakia, will become Europe's cultural flagships. Learn more about how Europe's Capitals of Culture program brings lasting change to cities.

events.title: Conscription, pensions and AfD on Germany's 2026 agenda
events.summary: Pensions, migration and conscription will continue to dominate domestic politics in Germany this year. Above all, the focus will be on how the far-right AfD fares in upcoming state elections in the former East Germany.

events.title: Germany: Merz says 2026 can be a 'year of new beginnings'
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz touched on war in Ukraine, increased defense spending, changing ties to the US, technological upheaval, industrial stagnation, sluggish reforms, migration and more in his New Year's address.

events.title: France plans social media ban for children under 15: reports
events.summary: After Australia's world-first social-media ban for minors, France has drafted a similar law to block under-15s from major platforms, which could take effect from September.

events.title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance
events.summary: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

events.title: A German tip for your New Year's resolutions
events.summary: Starting off the year with ambitious plans to become a better person is a widespread Western tradition. What are the most popular resolutions in Germany? And here's how the German language can help you deal with yours.

events.title: Six ways the 2026 World Cup will be different
events.summary: The United States is set to host the 2026 World Cup, along with Canada and Mexico. DW fills you in on why this tournament will be different than its predecessors.

events.title: Almost half of all Germans want a ban on fireworks
events.summary: In Germany, it's only permitted to sell fireworks in the three days leading up to New Year's Eve. Some line up early to buy them, while others have safety concerns and want to see them banned altogether.

events.title: Sudan defying war to bring joy at AFCON 2025
events.summary: A brutal civil war has been raging in Sudan since 2023. The national football team is participating in the Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco with more than just sporting success in mind.

events.title: What challenges does the world economy face in 2026?
events.summary: From trade tensions and high debt burdens to fears of an AI stocks bubble, the global economy will face an array of risks that could dampen growth in the new year.

events.title: Taiwan heavily reliant on Russian energy for chip manufacturing
events.summary: The island imports significant qualities of Russian naphtha, a fossil-fuel derivative needed in the high-tech sector. Until recently, it also sourced much of its coal from Russia.

events.title: New Year's Eve: How to make resolutions for 2026
events.summary: Quit smoking, exercise more, eat healthier: Every January 1, we plan to do great things over the next year — only to fail most of the time. Here's how to make sure your New Year's resolutions work out.

events.title: Lufthansa and the role of big business in the Holocaust
events.summary: German airline Lufthansa is one of many big-name brands that collaborated with the Nazis during the Holocaust. As the airline celebrates its 100th anniversary, why does its Nazi past continue to fly under the radar?

events.title: Bulgaria joining eurozone is big deal
events.summary: The southeastern European country is set to ditch its national currency in favor of the euro. But while Bulgaria's economy has improved, mismanagement and corruption remain rampant.

events.title: Aurora lights: The science behind the dazzling nighttime spectacle
events.summary: The northern and southern lights have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

events.title: AI chatbots are 'alarmingly' biased against dialect speakers
events.summary: Don't speak perfect Oxford English? You may face "shocking" levels of discrimination when using large language models, researchers have found. New customized AI models could be the answer.

events.title: Climate coverage shrinks amid Trump's clean energy misinformation
events.summary: A strong majority of Americans say they're worried about the climate. So why do they hear so little about it in the news?

events.title: French actress and activist Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
events.summary: The French screen legend appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and dedicating herself to animal rights activism.

events.title: German company Miele to sell more refurbished appliances
events.summary: The secondhand smartphone market has grown significantly in recent years, but other, bulkier items like washing machines are less frequently refurbished and resold. That could soon be changing.

events.title: Germany's COVID-19 response under scrutiny
events.summary: A parliamentary inquiry has been looking into the policy decisions made to contain the coronavirus pandemic in Germany. The decisions made by key leaders from the time are being questioned.

events.title: Achraf Hakimi and football's growing issue: playing time
events.summary: According to a new FIFPRO report, Morocco and Paris Saint-Germain star Achraf Hakimi is a footballer at his limit, having had a season that lasted nearly a whole year. After an injury, he is now at AFCON with Morocco.

events.title: Germany at the 2026 World Cup: What next?
events.summary: Now that they have qualified and drawn in group E, Germany head into the final part of their 2026 World Cup preparations. Here's what to know.

events.title: Why Germany struggles to go digital
events.summary: Germany still leans on fax machines and paperwork for basic public services. How can a nation of tech pioneers be so slow to adopt digital government?

events.title: Peak oil: Why the world can't break its fossil fuel habit
events.summary: Climate change shifted the oil production debate from scarcity to demand. If countries do not deliver on ambitious green pledges, one expert predicts that production may peak within two years, forcing a chaotic decline.

events.title: Berlin: Archaeological finds illuminate the city's medieval past
events.summary: A brand-new museum showcases the many fascinating medieval artefacts that archaeologists are finding underneath the German capital.

events.title: Munich surfers abandon attempt to restart Eisbach wave
events.summary: City authorities are putting up unnecessary resistance to restoring the world-famous surf spot, the local sports association said.

events.title: Football: Afghan women make statement on international stage
events.summary: Afghanistan's female footballers have been fighting in exile to get back to playing internationally for years. Earlier this year, their moment arrived, but their mission is far from complete.

events.title: Germany's empty churches repurposed as congregations shrink
events.summary: The number of practicing Christians in Germany is falling. The result is surplus churches. What happens to these empty houses of worship?

events.title: Can dogs really sense danger?
events.summary: Research shows what canines really can sense — and how social media and human projection fuel belief in their supernatural abilities.

events.title: From Ukraine to US: Germany's 2026 foreign policy challenges
events.summary: Germany enters 2026 facing a world in upheaval. Whether navigating relations with the United States, Ukraine, China or Middle Eastern governments, Germany is struggling to keep pace with rapid geopolitical shifts.

events.title: The Christmas truce of 1914: When the guns fell silent
events.summary: On Christmas Eve 1914, battling German and British soldiers laid down their arms and sang Christmas carols together — a brief moment of peace in the midst of war.

events.title: Germany's far-right AfD may seize regional power in 2026
events.summary: The Alternative for Germany (AfD) will seek power in next year's state elections. Civil society groups are alarmed, as are security services, which have found that some of its factions represent extremist threats.

events.title: 7 mysterious languages that have yet to be deciphered
events.summary: Indus, Rongorongo, Linear A: Some ancient writing systems cannot be deciphered. Can artificial intelligence help crack the codes of the past?

events.title: How Germany's Deutsche Bahn aims to fix chronic delays
events.summary: German trains used to run like clockwork. Today, delays are the rule, not the exception. As public anger is boiling over, what went wrong with a system once envied worldwide, and why are the Swiss getting it right?

events.title: Ryanair faces massive fine in Italy over 'abusive strategy'
events.summary: Italy's competition authority AGCM claims the budget airline blocked payment methods and mass-deleted accounts to manipulate travel agencies and force them into partnerships. Ryanair has pledged to appeal the fine.

events.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un, daughter open luxury resort
events.summary: Five new hotels were opened in Samjiyon, near the Chinese border, with Kim Jong Un praising the "rising status" of North Korea's people.

events.title: This is how Christmas is celebrated at the Vatican
events.summary: This year, Pope Leo XIV will lead the Christmas celebrations at the Vatican for the first time. But the popular Christmas traditions at the heart of the Roman Catholic Church remain unchanged.

events.title: Why Trump backs Bayer in Roundup weedkiller cancer battle
events.summary: The Trump administration has diverged from the position of former US President Joe Biden, throwing its weight behind German chemical giant Bayer in its courtroom battle over the pesticide Roundup.

events.title: AFCON: A 3,000-kilometer bike ride to catch the opener
events.summary: The Africa Cup of Nations is drawing thousands of fans to Morocco, and one chose an unusual way to get there. Moroccan fan Ismail Skira cycled thousands of kilometers from Paris for the opening match.

events.title: Christmas in the air: Why scents spark emotions and memories
events.summary: The scent of fresh pine and apple cider makes you think of the holidays at grandma's house? You're not alone. Smells are our strongest sensory trigger for memories — both happy and painful.

events.title: Germany registers over 1,000 suspicious drone flights in 2025
events.summary: Drone sightings this year have disrupted German airports, causing headaches for travelers. Germany has ordered special anti-aircraft tanks to combat the unmanned aerial vehicles.

events.title: AI language models duped by poems
events.summary: A new study has shown that prompts in the form of poems confuse AI models like ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude — to the point where sometimes, security mechanisms don't kick in. Are poets the new hackers?

events.title: Germany: 1,600 asylum requests by people rejected at border
events.summary: The German government said hundreds of people turned away at the border later applied for asylum. Meanwhile, Berlin's mayor is warning New Year's Eve's trouble makers. DW has the latest.

events.title: Germany trains immigrant teachers to fill gaps in schools
events.summary: Germany is desperately looking for teachers. And many migrants and refugees were once teachers in their home country. A program in Cologne — and four other cities — is hoping to create a win-win situation.

events.title: How Georgian creatives are fighting for their freedom
events.summary: Artists in Georgia are weary but defiant as they face arbitrary arrests, tough new laws and financial hardship from the country's repressive government.

events.title: 'Avatar': How the Na'vi language was constructed
events.summary: Very few people get to invent a new language that is heard by millions: DW talked to linguist Paul Frommer about how he developed the "Avatar" aliens' language.

events.title: Perfume's multicultural journey: From antiquity to TikTok
events.summary: Though often marketed through a Eurocentric lens, perfume's multilayered history spans Mesopotamia, India, Egypt and Europe, besides being retold on PerfumeTok.

events.title: Labor rights in Europe: Who's working over Christmas?
events.summary: From the number of paid days off to the size of the Christmas bonus, not all European countries are equal for workers over the holidays.

events.title: Christmas brings rise in domestic violence in Germany
events.summary: For many women, the holiday season is the most dangerous time of the year. Stress, financial worries, and cramped living conditions increase the risk of domestic violence. Women's shelters are overstretched.

events.title: Not just hocus pocus: when words were used to treat the sick
events.summary: Incantations were not only meant to ward off demons, but also to calm patients. A look into medical history reveals what lies behind the idea of tooth worms and the power of utterances like "hocus pocus."

events.title: 3I/ATLAS: Interstellar comet comes closest to Earth
events.summary: Sometimes "the universe comes to us," writes the European Space Agency. On Friday it came really close, when comet 3l/ATLAS passed by us at a ― relatively ― short distance. What exactly is this interstellar visitor?

events.title: Netflix vs. Paramount takeover battle for Warner Bros.: What's at stake?
events.summary: The multi-billion dollar bidding war to acquire Warner Bros. may soon be over. How are the negotiations connected to Harry Potter, Trump, TikTok — and the future of cinema?

events.title: German business bankruptcies hit decade high amid downturn
events.summary: Business bankruptcies have climbed to an 11-year high, with small firms hardest hit by Germany's anemic growth. Economists warn of job losses but see tentative signs that the insolvency wave may be leveling off.

events.title: Five things to know about AFCON
events.summary: Excellent infrastructure, ambitious teams, young stars and veterans who are far from finished — the 35th edition of AFCON promises plenty.

events.title: Can Santa Claus survive in a melting world?
events.summary: As climate change warms the planet, snowy winters are becoming less certain in Europe. Those looking for classic Christmas traditions are learning to adapt.

events.title: Plane owned by ex-NASCAR driver Greg Biffle crashes in US
events.summary: A small aircraft owned by Greg Biffle crashed and exploded while attempting to land at Statesville Regional Airport in North Carolina. Seven people died in the crash, including the 56-year-old retired NASCAR driver.

events.title: Pioneering gay rights filmmaker Rosa von Praunheim dies at 83
events.summary: His 1971 film "It Is Not the Homosexual Who Is Perverse, but the Society in Which He Lives" is widely credited with triggering the modern gay rights movement in German-language countries.

events.title: Bayern Munich buy ex-Bundesliga stadium for women's team
events.summary: Bayern Munich are set to purchase a larger stadium for their women's team. The club's CEO described the move as "another milestone" for Bayern's women's program.

events.title: Women's health suffers, bearing the brunt of household labor
events.summary: Even as economic roles shift in romantic partnerships, women still shoulder most of the labor at home. Research suggests this is a burden affecting women's health, leading to emotional fatigue and depression.

events.title: Euro 2029 in Germany about more than profit margins
events.summary: Hosting Euro 2029 is a chance for women's football in Germany to leave a legacy beyond profit and prove investment in women is smart move.

events.title: Cheaper, cleaner energy drives Germany's balcony-solar boom
events.summary: The home-fitted renewable-energy sources are inexpensive and easy to install, and reduce electricity costs. Here's what can be learned from their surging popularity in Germany.

events.title: Merz touts EU-Mercosur deal while France, Italy protest
events.summary: The EU-Latin America trade deal has been in the making for a quarter of a century. Though Germany's chancellor called for its completion, France and Italy said it would be "premature" to sign.

events.title: Wealthy nations curb labor migration as demand surges
events.summary: Even before Donald Trump returned to the White House, anti-immigration politics were reshaping migration flows to high-income countries. Borders have been tightened despite economies facing urgent labor shortages.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' hit a record
events.summary: Silver just reached an all-time high of $67. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Venezuela blockade: What it would mean for the Maduro regime and oil markets
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has threatened Venezuela with a naval blockade to thwart its oil exports — a move that would hit the Maduro government hard but may leave global oil markets unfazed.

events.title: Why US giant Chevron, not China, may save oil-rich Venezuela
events.summary: Chevron is driving Venezuela's oil rebound while China is pulling back. As the fate of President Nicolas Maduro grows uncertain, Washington's renewed leverage is reshaping the country's economic and geopolitical future.

events.title: Louvre partially back in action despite walkout
events.summary: Louvre workers voted to extend a strike as security scrutiny at the world famous museum intensifies.

events.title: AFCON offers hope after World Cup heartbreak
events.summary: Several established African teams ,like Nigeria, did not qualify for World Cup 2026 despite an expanded format. The Africa Cup of Nations, which begins this weekend, offers a different challenge and a chance to build.

events.title: Under-fire FIFA announces $60 World Cup tickets, for the few
events.summary: The good news? FIFA responded to outrage at the most expensive World Cup ever with discount tickets comparable to the cost of a normal game for "loyal fans." The bad news? It's for a tiny share of the tickets.

events.title: Why Germany's auto capitals face financial crisis
events.summary: The crisis in Germany’s revered car industry is taking a toll on its wealthiest regions — and hitting the pocketbooks of residents.

events.title: Messi's India tour and rise of the solo athlete sports brand
events.summary: In 2025, many global sports stars went on promotional tours purely to support their individual brands. Lionel Messi's tour of India is a reminder of how sport is changing.

events.title: Gas-loving Trump cedes electric car market to China
events.summary: Donald Trump is pushing gas guzzlers over EVs — in spite of climate and cost concerns. China is now set to race further ahead into an electrified automotive future.

events.title: Medical experts are pushing back on new US vaccine policy
events.summary: US health agencies under Robert F Kennedy Jr. and American medical groups are in conflict over childhood vaccination policy. At the heart of the clash is a long debunked, persistent myth about vaccine safety.

events.title: A pre-Christmas warning: Cheap toys can pose health hazard
events.summary: For kids, presents are meant to be a source of happiness and fun. But some plastic gifts can be a health risk. Here's why.

events.title: Can Lionel Messi's visit boost Indian football?
events.summary: As Lionel Messi embarks on a four-city tour of India, the footballing community there is hoping it will have a long-term impact on the state of global game in a country where cricket remains king.

events.title: Holiday stargazing: meteor showers and supermoons ahead
events.summary: One of the biggest meteor showers of the year will peak in mid-December, ahead of an early January supermoon.

events.title: Catastrophic US floods linked to hotter climate
events.summary: Rising temperatures and extreme rainfall might not seem connected, but they often are. Here's how.

events.title: African Youth Games important, but sustainability is key
events.summary: Seven years after the last edition, Africa's sports stars of tomorrow are getting the chance to compete and develop their talent in Angola.

events.title: India's 2026 space bid: Three Gaganyaan missions by March
events.summary: Can India overcome years of delays to finally send its own spacecraft astronauts into orbit? That depends on crucial launches in the coming months.

events.title: Goodbye climate protection? How the EU is weakening its Green Deal
events.summary: European industrial and agricultural concerns are facing diluted environmental regulations, while the bloc as a whole has reduced its climate targets. What's at stake and how do far-right parties feature in the mix?

events.title: FBL aiming to take women's football in Germany to new level
events.summary: The football clubs that make up the Bundesliga have gone it alone in forming a new league organization to better develop and market the women's game in Germany.

events.title: Too close to Trump? FIFA President Infantino under pressure
events.summary: FairSquare has accused FIFA President Gianni Infantino of repeatedly violating political neutrality. The NGO is calling for an investigation, also because of a peace prize awarded to Donald Trump.

events.title: Are mosquitoes the most dangerous animals in the world?
events.summary: Malaria, dengue, Zika virus and West Nile fever are all diseases that can be spread by mosquitoes. Hundreds of thousands of people die from such infections every year.

events.title: Iran security forces attack hospital after protests in western region
events.summary: Videos verified by the Observers team show Iranian security forces attacking a hospital to arrest injured protesters in Ilam, western Iran, on the night of January 3-4. Earlier in the day, Iranian security forces opened fire on a peaceful protest in the nearby town of Arkavaz. Local reports say at least three people were killed.

events.title: Storm Goretti set to batter Europe with heavy wind, rain and snow
events.summary: Several regions accross Europe will be buffeted by severe weather ranging from "exceptionally strong winds" to snow and freezing temperatures with the arrival of Storm Goretti on Thursday. The UK, France and Germany will bear the brunt of the storm, with Britain's Met Office issuing a "rare" red wind warning for the Isles of Scilly and Cornwall in southwestern England.

events.title: 'Trump does not speak of freedom but fundamentally of oil,' Venezuelan opponent Arria says
events.summary: In an interview with FRANCE 24, veteran Venezuelan opposition figure Diego Arria criticised US President Donald Trump's approach following the capture of President Nicolas Maduro by US special forces on January 3. "I was very concerned that the president does not speak of the recovery of freedom (...) of liberating the political prisoners, but speaks fundamentally of oil," he said.

events.title: Minneapolis: ICE agent fatally shoots woman during raid
events.summary:
In Minneapolis, a woman driver was killed by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent on Wednesday.
 
Donald Trump said the killing was an act of “self-defense,” a claim that has been strongly disputed by local elected officials.

events.title: US and Colombia hold call as country protests Trump's threats
events.summary:
United States President Donald Trump has invited Colombian leader Gustavo Petro to the White House, days after accusing him of trafficking cocaine and threatening military action against his government.

The sudden detente on Wednesday followed an hour-long phone call between Trump and Petro, in which the two leaders discussed “the situation of drugs” and “other disagreements”, according to the US president. France24 Senior reporter James André tells us more from Bogota, Colombia.

events.title: US president's agenda tests world order
events.summary: In the wake of the US military’s dramatic capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, President Trump and his top advisers have made increasingly explicit that their next focus could be Greenland, discussing options ranging from a purchase from Denmark to the unprecedented suggestion of using US forces to seize the strategically located Arctic territory, raising urgent questions about how Europe should respond to an increasingly belligerent White House and defend the sovereignty of a NATO ally. Irish Member of the Parliament for Renew Europe, Barry Andrews, shares his insights.

events.title: Brazil's Lula vetoes law reducing prison time for Bolsonaro
events.summary: Brazil's left-wing President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Thursday vetoed a law that would significantly reduce the prison sentence of former far-right leader Jair Bolsonaro, who was jailed in November after being convicted of trying to cling to power in a landmark coup trial seen as a test of Brazilian democracy.

events.title: Inside Iran's nationwide protests: Security forces attack hospital after protests in western Iran
events.summary: Videos verified by the Observers team show Iranian security forces attacking a hospital in Ilam, Iran, on the night of 3-4 January. The footage shows security forces firing shotguns and tear gas as they attempt to detain injured protesters. Earlier in the day, security forces opened fire on a protest in the nearby town of Arkavaz. The protests began in December 2025, driven by Iran’s economic crisis, and have spread nationwide. HRANA says at least 36 protesters have been killed so far. France24 Observers journalist Ershad Alijani explains.

events.title: Booker Prize winner David Szalay on his 'risky' novel 'Flesh' that vowed the literary world
events.summary: British-Hungarian author David Szalay joins Eve Jackson on arts24 to discuss his controversial Booker Prize-winning novel "Flesh", which follows István – a silent, violent and unsettling protagonist – from a bleak Hungarian housing estate to London's super-rich elite. Szalay reveals why he called his book "risky," how he made readers care about someone who says "OK" 400 times and what happens when Stormzy and Dua Lipa champion your work.

events.title: ‘I spent almost four months in a prison cell’: Journalist Mario Guevara on covering ICE
events.summary: Arrested while reporting on an anti-Trump protest outside Atlanta, Salvadoran journalist Mario Guevara spent 112 days in ICE detention before being deported to El Salvador despite holding a valid US work permit and press credentials. He spoke to FRANCE 24 about press freedom under US President Donald Trump and the difficulty of reporting on ICE raids.

events.title: Japan's iconic digital pet Tamagotchi turns 30
events.summary:
It's been about 30 years since the Tamagotchi became the must-have toy for children around the globe. Now, 3 decades on, the humble tamagotchi is inspiring a new generation of electronic pets.
 
France 24's Luke Shrago dons his nostalgia glasses and takes a look.

events.title: What does it take to become French? A look at the new requirements
events.summary: In this edition of Entre Nous, we take a look at the new, tougher requirements to obtain French citizenship and multi-year visas. We go through what's on the new tests and we also dive into why Hollywood star George Clooney and his family didn't need to take them!

events.title: Russia frees imprisoned French researcher Laurent Vinatier
events.summary: Russia has freed Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin. France24 Angela Diffley explains further.

events.title: Russia frees French researcher Vinatier convicted under country's 'foreign agents' law
events.summary: Russia has freed Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin. Eliza Herbert and Laurent Berstecher report.

events.title: Policing the sky: NATO’s high-risk patrols near Ukraine
events.summary: The war in Ukraine has not only reshaped borders on the ground but also transformed the airspace above Europe, forcing NATO’s European allies to redefine aerial security by patrolling a tense new frontier over the Black Sea in what is described as a “policing of the sky” mission aimed at upholding international law and signaling the Alliance’s readiness to respond to any provocation; several times a year, the French Air Force leads these high-risk operations over Romanian waters, to which our reporters Pauline Godart and Olivia Bizot were granted exclusive access.

events.title: Fatal ICE shooting sparks protests in Minneapolis
events.summary: Demonstrators flooded the streets of Minneapolis overnight after a U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer fatally shot a 37-year-old woman on Wednesday, igniting anger among residents and local officials who were already upset by the Trump administration’s sweeping immigration enforcement operations in the city. Director of the Immigrant Lab and Associate professor at the American University in Washington DC, Ernesto Castaneda, explains further.

events.title: Russia frees imprisoned French researcher Laurent Vinatier
events.summary: Russia will free Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin.

events.title: Yemeni separatist chief fled to UAE, Saudi-led coalition says
events.summary: Yemeni separatist leader Aidarous Al-Zubaidi has fled to the United Arab Emirates with Emirati help after a failed military advance that strained relations between the Gulf countries, the country's Saudi-led coalition said on Thursday.  Al-Zubaidi was accused of high treason and removed from Yemen's Presidential Leadership Council on Wednesday.

events.title: Venezuela's crude concessions: US vows to exert control over world's largest oil reserves
events.summary: What's next for Venezuela, where a surprise attack saw US forces capture President Nicolas Maduro and his wife? Is getting control of the country's oil reserves the most important motivation for US President Donald Trump? Charles Pellegrin talks to David Goldwyn, president of Goldwyn Global Strategies and former US State Department special envoy and coordinator for international energy affairs from 2009 to 2011.

events.title: Favourite foods: What the French like to eat
events.summary: France is known around the world for its delicious food: not only wine and cheese, but also countless mouth-watering regional dishes. So what do the French like to eat? Do they have a favourite food? Is it even possible to choose? As a bonus, we teach you how to make boeuf bourguignon, the king of classic French cuisine.

events.title: A long-held desire: Why does the US want Greenland?
events.summary: The Trump administration is signalling no retreat in its goal of acquiring Greenland, a semi-autonomous Danish territory, after the White House said the president wasn't ruling out the use of military force. Speaking to FRANCE 24, Mikaa Blugeon-Mered, an expert on hydrogen geopolitics and Greenland, says the US president's rhetoric is "decredibilising" the NATO alliance. What's more, he adds, "out of all the NATO allies, Denmark is the best of all."

events.title: Russia frees imprisoned French researcher Laurent Vinatier
events.summary: Russia has freed Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin.

events.title: REPLAY: French President Macron addresses diplomatic corps
events.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron warned that the United States was "breaking free from international rules" as he addressed top diplomats on Thursday in a traditional New Year speech designed to spell out France's foreign policy priorities for the 12 months ahead.

events.title: Indians suffer from health scourge of noise pollution
events.summary: Between traffic, excessive use of car horns, building sites and religious celebrations, the ears of residents in Indian megacities like New Delhi and Mumbai rarely get a moment of respite. Authorities remain silent on possible solutions to combat this health scourge. Our correspondents Lisa Gamonet and Alban Alvarez report.

events.title: What happened on Iran's 'Bloody Saturday'?
events.summary: In a place called Malekshahi, in western Iran, protesters converge on a base run by the revolutionary guards.

events.title: Bodies of man and boy discovered at separate homes
events.summary: The bodies of a man and a boy have been discovered at two separate homes in west Dublin.

events.title: Tens of thousands flee fighting in Aleppo, Syria, after evacuation order
events.summary: Thousands have been forced from their homes in Aleppo after people were ordered to evacuate amid fighting between the Syrian army and Kurdish forces.

events.title: How UK helped US seize tanker - and how it tried to escape
events.summary: For more than two weeks, Sky News' Data and Forensics team has plotted the movements of the US-sanctioned oil tanker Marinera.

events.title: Who will join the UK and France in sending peacekeeping troops to Ukraine?
events.summary: The UK and France have pledged to deploy peacekeeping troops in Ukraine in the event of a peace deal.

events.title: What we know about tankers seized by US - as Russia responds
events.summary: America has seized two sanctioned oil tankers linked to Venezuela in back-to-back operations in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean.

events.title: Australia secure 4-1 Ashes win against England with victory in final Test
events.summary: Australia's cricketers have secured a 4-1 victory in the Ashes after beating England in the fifth Test in Sydney.

events.title: US aims to control Venezuela oil sales 'indefinitely'
events.summary: The White House has said it aims to control sales of Venezuela's oil "indefinitely" as the Trump administration draws up plans for US oil companies to return to the nation.

events.title: Funeral held for French movie and style icon Brigitte Bardot
events.summary: Brigitte Bardot's funeral has been held with a private service in Saint-Tropez.

events.title: Boat and engine supplier who 'made millions' off migrant crossings jailed
events.summary: A Turkish national has been jailed for 11 years after being found guilty of supplying thousands of small boats and engines used by people smugglers to transport asylum seekers across the English Channel.

events.title: Brazil’s Lula vetoes bill that could reduce Bolsonaro’s prison time
events.summary: Brazil’s President Lula da Silva has vetoed a bill that could reduce Jair Bolsonaro’s 27-year prison sentence for his failed 2023 coup attempt

events.title: Venezuela to release a 'significant number' of prisoners as gesture to 'seek peace'
events.summary: Venezuela plans to release a "significant number" of prisoners, both Venezuelan and foreign, according to the head of the national assembly

events.title: Somalia denies US allegation that it destroyed food aid warehouse
events.summary: Somalia’s government is denying an allegation by the U.S. government that authorities in Mogadishu destroyed an American-funded warehouse belonging to the World Food Program

events.title: Lebanese pop star turned militant Fadel Shaker tells court he is innocent
events.summary: A Lebanese pop star turned Islamic militant has claimed innocence in a military court

events.title: Rubio lays out Venezuela plan focused on stabilization, recovery and transition
events.summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio laid out a "three-fold process" for Venezuela focused on stabilization, recovery and transition. Rubio also confirmed that the U.S. will sell 30 to 50 million barrels of Venezuelan oil. NBC News' Monica Alba reports on the plan detailed by Rubio and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.

events.title: U.S. secures oil tanker linked to Venezuela, officials say
events.summary: U.S. officials told NBC News that an operation was launched to seize a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the northern Atlantic that is linked to Venezuela. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports on why the U.S. views the ship as stateless.

events.title: A look at who's who in Venezuela's current leadership
events.summary: After deposed President Nicolás Maduro was detained by the U.S., attention shifted to the other influential figures in Venezuela who may shape the country's future. NBC News’ George Solis breaks down the main members of Maduro’s administration and the opposition.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Swiss bar fire was like 'hell': Survivors recount ski resort blaze
events.summary: CRANS-MONTANA, Switzerland — Ringing in the new year with a night of drinking and dancing high in the Swiss Alps, Ebenezer Mehari, 17, decided to take a breather outside the packed Constellation Bar

events.title: Welcome, 2026! Here are the landmark events that will happen in the new year.
events.summary: This new year will be filled with milestones, including America’s 250th birthday, the world’s greatest sports competitions and a mission to the moon.

events.title: How Japan is fighting back against a surge of bear attacks
events.summary: ODATE, Japan — Before students can come out to play at his school, Yoji Hikage has to give the all clear.

events.title: At Gaza's only animal shelter, workers share what food they have with hungry dogs and cats
events.summary: A humble shelter operating out of a tent remains the last beacon of hope for the injured and hungry animal population in war-ravaged Gaza, even as its workers and volunteers face their own impossible conditions.“You cannot look at a creature that trusts you and eat in front of it without sharing,” Saeed Al-Aar, who founded the Sulala Animal Rescue shelter in 2006, told NBC News last month

events.title: Trump's exit from global climate treaty leaves U.S. without a voice in negotiations
events.summary: President Trump's executive order put an end to decades of U.S. support for the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, leaving the country without a voice in global climate talks.

events.title: Venezuela says it will release an 'important number' of political prisoners
events.summary: The government said it was a "unilateral gesture" to maintain peace;  families of those imprisoned have been calling for their release.

events.title: U.S. tanker seizures put pressure on Russian 'shadow fleet' and Putin's economy
events.summary: The U.S. seizure of a Russian-flagged oil tanker threatened new pressure on the “shadow fleet” that has helped prop up President Vladimir Putin’s economy

events.title: U.S. seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker that fled blockade of Venezuela
events.summary: The United States has seized the Bella 1, which changed its name to the Marinera, a Russian-flagged oil tanker pursued by the Coast Guard off Venezuela.

events.title: Video shows security forces firing tear gas at protesters as Iran crackdown kills dozens
events.summary: Protesters in Iran defied authorities Tuesday, hitting the streets in the capital, Tehran, and smaller cities to chant anti-government slogans amid an ongoing violent crackdown that one human rights group says has left at least 36 dead

events.title: A tense calm on the streets of Caracas masks fears and uncertainty for Venezuelans
events.summary: Residents in the capital said they are seeing an increased presence of government security forces as well as armed civilian paramilitaries loyal to the government.

events.title: U.S. allies say 'Greenland belongs to its people' as Trump escalates threats
events.summary: President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner and special envoy Steve Witkoff were meeting with the Coalition of the Willing in Paris on security guarantees.

events.title: Growing Iran protests rattle leaders as Trump threatens to intervene
events.summary: Widespread protests have rocked Iran for more than a week and led to increasing violent clashes with security forces, prompting President Donald Trump to threaten intervention if a crackdown continues

events.title: Trump says the U.S. isn't at war with Venezuela
events.summary: Venezuela will not have new elections in the next 30 days, Trump said in an NBC News interview, projecting a longer-term engagement after U.S. forces captured Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Next stop, Nuuk? U.S. allies fear Trump may target Greenland after Venezuela
events.summary: Copenhagen may be 5,200 miles away from Caracas, but the thrum of the helicopters that grabbed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro will have been deafening in the Danish capital

events.title: China condemns Maduro capture, but some see it as a chance to assert its global position
events.summary: BEIJING — An attack on a country after a military buildup and embargo at sea.

events.title: Trump says U.S. is 'in charge' of Venezuela and warns interim leader to cooperate
events.summary: Trump laid out a stark warning to Venezuelan interim leader Delcy Rodríguez, saying in an interview with The Atlantic that “if she doesn’t do what’s right, she is going to pay a very big price, probably bigger than Maduro.”
